sentences: This item (FCCC/SBI/2014/4 and MISC.1) was introduced during SBI plenary on 4 June.
Nauru, for AOSIS, called for predictable and sustainable support, and for finance to come from the GCF.
Bhutan, for the LDCs, lamented inadequate financing, and called for expanding the guidelines for the formulation of NAPs before COP 20.
Ghana, for the G-77/China, underscored the need to link NAPs to the GCF, and said funding for NAPs should be simple, expedited and sustainable.
The item was subsequently discussed in informal consultations co-facilitated by Margaret Mukahanana-Sangarwe (Zimbabwe) and Tomasz Chruszczow (Poland).
